text: Medication Generic and Trade Classification Action and Why is Patient Taking Medication Side Effects Nursing Implications Erythromycin ophthalmic ointment Antibacterial Apply to the eyes of the newborn. Protection of viral infections passed from mom to baby. Irritation, blurred vision, allergic reactions Look for signs of discomfort, swelling around the eyes. Is baby able to focus on things close? Hepatitis B vaccine Vaccine Routine immunization of children Minor local reactions such as local tenderness, pain at injection site, anorexia, fever, myalgia Inspect injection site for redness and swelling. Watch activity level of baby and close attention for sign of stiffness/pain on extremity of injection site Phytonadione (Vitamin K) Anticoagulants Treatment of warfarin overdosage, prophylaxis of Vitamin K deficiency of newborns Gastric upset, unusual taste, flushing, rash, urticaria, erythema, pain and/ or swelling at injection site Inspect injection site for redness and swelling. Watch activity level of baby and close attention for sign of stiffness/pain on extremity of injection site
